headline: Cheeseburger Casserole with Tater Tots
description: Convenience items such as condensed soup and frozen potato nuggets join Cheddar cheese and ground beef in this cheeseburger casserole topped with crunchy Tater Tots.
name: Cheeseburger Casserole with Tater Tots
recipeIngredient: 2 (10.75 ounce) cans condensed golden mushroom soup (such as Campbell's®)
1 (32 ounce) package frozen bite-size potato nuggets (such as Tater Tots®)

recipeInstructions.text: Place onion in a microwave-safe bowl and cover with water. Microwave on high until soft, 7 to 8 minutes. Drain.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a 9x13-inch casserole dish with cooking spray.
Cook and stir ground beef in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain and discard grease.

Transfer beef to the prepared casserole dish and spread onion pieces evenly over top. Spread soup over onions and sprinkle Cheddar cheese evenly over soup. Layer frozen potato nuggets in rows on cheese.
Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes. Lightly spray potato nuggets with cooking spray, and bake until cooked through and crunchy, about 10 minutes more.

review.reviewBody: Delicious! My family and friends love this dish. I have saved the recipe. Thanks for sharing!

I made this tonight. Very simple recipe yet very good tasting. I had to use a gluten free condensed soup because half my family cannot have gluten. But that is a non issue as it likely tastes the same as Campbells, who obviously does not have the resources to accommodate those among us who have celiac disease. But I digress. I take umbrage with the onions cut into 1" squares. Why? It went against everything I know from my many years of cooking. But I did it anyway. If you are going to use this recipe, and I suggest you do for a great quick meal, DICE the onions and either sauté or cook with the hamburger. Only complaint. Other wise good, quick recipe. And maybe add some cooked mixed veggies. Sorry for the 3 star but the whole onion thing is dumb.
Absolutely delicious. Grandchildren loved it and requested it again
This recipe is as close to any of them as far as being close to the one we ate when we were children. Very good!!
Made this for me and it came out great. I ate great for a few days, for dinner nice...

I made this and everyone in the family loved it except my son who isn't fond of the tater tots...I didn't cook my hamburger meat first, I layed it on bottom of casserole dish, added chopped onion and red pepper, then the tater tots on top, then I mixed the cream of mushroom soup with seasonings and 1/2 can milk and poured over top, baked in oven for appx 50 minutes, turned out perfect
